channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 85 Chesterfield Grove Flytipping (along the wall) 4th Complaint, 11th December
item.description:
4th complaint. Wooden crate/pallet has still not been removed. This is a health and safety hazard as it could fall over and injure a pedestrian as well as it is fly tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Chesterfield Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping 11Dec25 Frederick Place, 11th December
item.description:
Photos taken 11th December 2025. More items dumped on the other side of the road on Frederick Place as you approached Burrage Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burrage Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on public pavement 11Dec25, 11th December
item.description:
Photos taken 11th December 2025. Items have been dumped here on Frederick Place for over a week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burrage Road, Plumstead

item.title: Car with no reg plates dumped on public road 11Dec25, 11th December
item.description:
Photos taken 11th December 2025. As depicted there’s an old car, with flat tyres and generally in a bad state, on a public parking spot at the Barnfield Estate with no registration plates. The car bears a striking resemblance to one of the same make, same colour, in the same spot that was SORN…

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keeble Close, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 11th December
item.description:
The bin is overflowing. Being by a bus stop it fills quickly and often overflows. Maybe there's a case for having an additional by the bus stop across the road, or perhaps this one could be emptied more frequently. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Cameron Road, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Throw rope / life ring missing, 11th December
item.description:
Glassmill Pond is deep (signposts say this) yet there is no life ring or throw rope available. People shouldn't be getting into the pond but clearly they do as there's evidence of graffiti on the left bank wall. Also a member of the public keeps removing the boulders put at the end of the channel for a reason by Thames21.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glassmill Lane, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked behind wheelchair accessible vehicle blocking access, 11th December
item.description:
I drive from my wheelchair and have a ramp at the back of my car allowing me to enter my car. A car (registration number: GK13 SKX) parked half in my disabled spot and half on the yellow line blocking my way in. As a result I had to leave my car there and take a taxi home

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gresham Street, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet
